title: Lophostemon suaveolens
text:
Lophostemon suaveolens is a tree species, also known as swamp mahogany, swamp box or swamp turpentine, of the botanical family <a href="Myrtaceae">Myrtaceae</a>.
It grows to a medium-sized tree, native in <a href="Australia">Australia</a> and <a href="New%20Guinea">New Guinea</a>.
In Australia, botanical sources describe it as naturally occurring from the north coast of <a href="NSW">NSW</a> through eastern <a href="Queensland">Queensland</a> to <a href="Cape%20York%20Peninsula">Cape York Peninsula</a>, including the <a href="Queensland%20tropical%20rain%20forests">Queensland wet tropics</a> where it extends up to 900m above sea level; it grows in swampy ground or alluvial river flats, in open forests, <a href="gallery%20forest">gallery forest</a>s, and the margins of rainforests.
